Key Match Events: Gronbaek (36') scored the first goal of the match
Poulsen (61') scored the second goal of the match
Andersen (51') and Kristansen (59') were shown yellow cards for Denmark
Lukic (70'), Pavlovic (72'), and Mitrovic (71') were shown yellow cards for Serbia
Pre-Game Insights: Denmark have won 11 of their last 12 home matches
Serbia need to show more in attack, and with no Mitrovic or Vlahovic they could struggle in that regard
Denmark are favourites to win the match
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark manager Lars Knudsen praised his team's performance after the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Parken in Copenhagen
Others: Serbia's squad is almost unrecognisable from the one that was selected for Euro 2024
Denmark lost the influential duo of Simon Kjaer and Thomas Delaney following Euro 2024
